title: Butterscotch Banana Bread Oatmeal Bites
about: Melanie found this recipe on her favorite blog - www.pbfingers.com. It's a nice healthy take on dessert. Perfect for kids or adults.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients together and thoroughly stir until everything is combined. ##Shape dough into small balls and place on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. The dough will be very moist and sticky, but it should hold its shape when formed into balls. ##Cook 15-18 minutes. Allow bites to cool and enjoy!

title: Brenda's Chocolate Mint Cookies
about: Brenda has been making these cookies for years and they've always been my favorite. The texture of the mint that has melted into the chocolate cookie is amazing. If you like chocolate mint you have to try these.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups firmly packed dark brown sugar
instructions: In a large heavy saucepan over low heat, cook butter or margarine, sugar and water until butter or margarine is molted. Add chocolate pieces and stir until partially melted. ##Remove from heat and continue to stir until chocolate is completely melted. Pour into large mixer bowl and let stand about 10 minutes to cool slightly, with mixer at high speed, beat in eggs one at a time. Reduce speed to low and add dry ingredients, beating just until blended. ##Chill dough about 1 hour for easier handling. ##Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 2 cookie sheet with foil. ##Roll teaspoonfuls of dough into balls; place about 2 inches apart on cookie sheets. ##Bake 12 to 13 minutes - no longer (they will look undone, but will crisp as they cool). Remove from oven and immediately place mint on each hot cookie. ##Allow To soften, then swirl mint over cookie. If desired, decorate with sprinkles. Remove from cookie sheets and cool completely. Makes 80

title: Brenda's Peanut Butter Kiss Cookies
about: This is another one of Brenda's classics. It's hard to go wrong with chocolate kisses over peanut butter cookies. Enjoy.
instructions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly in a medium size bowl. (Dough will be slightly sticky). With floured hands roll into 1 ¼ inch balls. ##Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 to 14 minutes until cookies look dry with tops cracked. ##Remove from oven immediately press a kiss in center of each cookie. Cool on cookie sheet for 1 to 2 minutes then remove.

title: Brenda's Peanut Butter Cake
about: This is a cake that Aunt Brenda first made for Jim's dad back in 1986. He loved it and the recipe has stuck around ever since.
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups of Nestle Peanut Butter morsels
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 1.5 cups of peanut butter morsels over hot (not boiling) water, and stir until smooth. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and 1/4 tsp. salt. ##In a large bowl, combine butter and sugar, then beat until creamy. Blend in the melted morsels, then beat in eggs and vanilla extract. -Alternately blend in flour and milk. ##Pour into 2 greased and floured 8 inch round cake pans. Bake 35 - 40 minutes, until crust is golden brown. ##Let cool for 10 minutes, remove from cake pan, then let cool completely. Fill layers and frost side and top of cake with peanut butter cream frosting (directions below). ##Garnish with coconut if desired. ##To make the peanut butter cream frosting, melt one cup of peanut butter morsels over hot (not boiling) water, and stir until smooth. ##In a large bowl, combine melted morsels, cream cheese, vanilla extract, and 1/8 tsp. salt. Beat well, then add powdered sugar alternately with milk until mixture is of spreading consistency.

title: Ava's Apple Crisp
about: This is the dessert Jessica made on Thanksgiving night, 2011. She ended up going into labor that night and the next day our sweet Ava was born. Its a great dessert that will always have sentimental value for us.
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter (one stick), cut into pieces
6 cups apples cored, chopped (peeled if desired)
instructions: Mix flour, brown sugar, 1/2 cup of white sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt together in a bowl. Combine butter in with the mixture using a fork or your fingers until coarse crumbs form. Stir in walnuts and set aside. Whisk together 1/3 cup sugar, cornstarch, ginger, and ½ teaspoon cinnamon. ##Place the apples in the bottom of the slow cooker, stir in the mixture from earlier (cornstarch mixture); toss with lemon juice. Sprinkle the walnut crumb topping (step 1 mixture) over the top. ##Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 hours or LOW for 4 hours, until apples are tender. ##After cooking time is complete, uncover the slow cooker to allow the topping to harden for about an hour. We serve this dish with vanilla ice cream!

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
about: This is a recipe we've been holding onto for some time now. It looks like a perfect holiday dish so we're going to have to make it soon.
ingredients: 1 package Chocolate Flavor Instant Pudding Mix
instructions: Prepare cake mix into batter using eggs, oil, and water. Pour into crock-pot. ##Prepare Jell-O Instant Chocolate Pudding Mix using milk. Pour this over cake mix in crock-pot. ##Sprinkle chocolate chips all over the top of the batter. Cook in crock-pot on high setting for 2 1/2 to 3 hours until cake is moist but not jiggle, and little volcanoes of spitting chocolate appear on top. ##Serve with ice cream, whipped topping, or on its own.

title: Heather's Crunchy Carmel Apple Pie
about: This recipe came from Jessica's cousin Heather. Apple pie is one of my all-time favs so I can't wait to try this.
ingredients: 1 pastry crust for a deep dish 9 inch pie
6 cups thinly sliced, peeled apples (Golden delicious and fuji apples are recommended)
instructions: Start by preparing the crumb topping. * Stir together brown sugar, flour and rolled oats. Cut in ½ cup butter until topping is like course crumbs. Set aside. ##In a large mixing bowl, stir together flour, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Add apple slices and gently toss until coated. ##Transfer apple mixture into the pie shell. Sprinkle crumb topping over apple mixture. Place pie on a cookie sheet to catch drippings. ##Cover edges with aluminum foil. Bake in a preheated 375 oven for 25 minutes, then remove foil and put back in for another 25-30 minutes w/out foil. ##Remove from oven. Sprinkle pie with chopped pecans and then drizzle with caramel on top. Cool on a wire rack and enjoy warm.

title: Festive Fudge
about: This recipe came from Uncle Jim and Aunt Brenda. Fudge was always my Dad's favorite.
ingredients: 1 (14 oz) can sweetened condensed milk (NOT evaporated milk)
instructions: In a heavy saucepan melt chocolate chips with condensed milk and salt over low heat. ##Remove from heat, stir in nuts (optional), and vanilla. Spread evenly into wax paper line 8 or 9 inch square pan. ##Chill for 2 hours, or until firm. Turn fudge onto cutting board; peel off paper and cut into squares. Store leftovers covered in refrigerator.

title: Sugar-Crusted Meltaways
about: This is one of Uncle Jim and Aunt Brenda's favorite dessert recipes.
ingredients: 1 package (6oz or 1 cup) semi-sweet chocolate chips
instructions: In a small bowl, combine orange peel and orange juice; set aside. ##In a large bowl, cream 1/4 cup sugar, salt, butter (or margarine), water, and vanilla. ##Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts; mix well. ##Shape dough into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. ##Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until firm to touch. ##Remove from cookie sheets; cool completely. ##Strain orange juice mixture; dip cookies in orange juice, roll in sugar. ##Allow to dry to form sugar shell. Note: Self-rising flour is not recommended.

title: Brenda's Boiled Chocolate Cookies
about: This is one of Aunt Brenda's old favorite recipes that she's been making for years. She said Kristy always loved these when she was a kid.
instructions: In a saucepan, mix milk, sugar, cocoa, and butter. ##Bring to a boil over medium heat, remove from heat and add oatmeal, peanut butter, and vanilla extract. ##Drop by tablespoon full onto wax paper, let harden and enjoy.

title: Rhubarb Custard Pie
about: This recipe came from Uncle Jim and Aunt Brenda
instructions: Mix eggs, milk, sugar, and flour, then add rhubarb. ##Pour into a pie shell and dot with butter. Cover with a lattice top. ##Bake at 400 degrees for 50 - 60 minutes, until browned. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

title: Sweet Potato Pie
about: This is one of Jim and Brenda's favorite dessert recipes.
ingredients: 1 large can or yams or 3 medium cooked yams
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into uncooked pie shell. Sprinkle with coconut if desired. ##Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes, until crust is golden brown. ##Let cool before slicing.

title: Amy's Caramel Rice Krispies
about: From Amy: Although rice krispies have been around forever this recipe offers an unusual slant and it came from a RN that I worked with in home care.
instructions: Melt butter and 4 cups of marshmallows, then add rice krispies. Spread in a buttered 9x13 pan. ##Next melt margarine, 2 cups of marshmallows, condensed milk, and caramels. ##Pour over rice krispies in pan and cool. ##Make a second batch of rice krispies and place over the top of the caramel mixture.

title: Amy's Chocolate Waffle Cookies
about: From Amy: Thought you might like this recipe since you now have a waffle iron.  Its easy to make and fun to do with the kids.
ingredients: 1/2 c of nuts if desired, just as good without
instructions: Mix cookie ingredients and drop onto a hot waffle iron. Cook the same as you would when making waffles. ##To make the frosting, melt baking chocolate and 3 tablespoons of butter, then add cream, powdered sugar, vanilla, and salt. ##Mix and frost cookies.

title: Sherry's Hot Chocolate
about: Amy sent this recipe that her Mom used to make every winter when she was a kid.
instructions: Mix all together and spoon into a cup of boiling water.

title: Pipkin Peanut Clusters
about: From Amy: These are a tradition for the holidays and can be make with any nut so Ava can enjoy too. This recipe is also easy to multiple and stores and freezes very well.
instructions: Melt chocolate chips, add almonds and Spanish peanuts (optional). ##Drop onto wax paper until hard.

title: Amy's Waldorf Red Cake
about: From Amy: This recipe has an interesting story on its origin and I used to request this cake for my birthdays.  You can find it in many different forms and box kits but the home made is the BEST.
instructions: Begin by making the cake. Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs. In small bowl add small amount of red food coloring to cocoa to make a paste. Add to to buttermilk alternately with cake flour and salt, then add vanilla. ##In another bowl combine baking soda and vinegar, when foaming add to cake mixture. ##Bake in two greased and floured round 8 inch cake pans at 350 for 30 minutes. ##When cool take a thread and slice each pan into 2, making 4 layers. ##For frosting, cook milk and flour until thick and then allow to cool. ##In another bowl, cream butter, sugar and vanilla for 15 minutes. ##Mix in flour mixture by spoonfuls and frost all 4 layers.

title: Amy's Brownies
about: From Amy: Anyone who knows me, knows that I love all things chocolate.  This recipe came from an RN that I worked with and when she would bring this into work it was a special treat.  I usually ate more than my share but that was back in the day when I could eat anything and not have to worry about the weight.  My how times have changed, but this recipe is still good.
ingredients: 1 c nuts (this can be omitted if desired)
instructions: Melt cocoa and butter until well mixed.  Remove from heat and mix in rest of ingredients in the order they are listed. Be sure to mix well. ##Place in a 9 x 13 pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool and frost. ##For frosting, Melt 4 T butter and 6 T cocoa. Remove from heat and blend in 3 T warm water. Stir and beat in 2 c powdered sugar.

title: Amy's Special K Bars
about: From Amy: I love these bars and could eat them by the pan full.  They call for peanut butter but I would try substituting Almond Butter so Ava can enjoy them too.
instructions: Stir syrup, sugar and peanut butter together and heat until melted. ##Remove from heat and stir in cereal and mix well. ##Press into a 9 x 13 pan. Melt chips and spread over the cereal mixture. ##Let set unitl firm.

title: Neiman Marcus Cookies
about: This is a recipe from Amy. Obviously the name implies where they came from. Amy said they used to make these every Christmas.
ingredients: 5 c blended (place in blender and mix until you have a fine powder) oatmeal
instructions: Cream butter and both sugars until well mixed. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. ##In a separate bowl, mix, flour, oatmeal, slat and both sodas. ##Add the two mixtures together, mixing well. Add chips, Hershey bar and nuts. ##Roll into small balls and bake for 10 minutes at 375.

title: Tom's Monster Cookies
about: Tom has a real sweet tooth and these cookies have a little of everything in them so you can eat them by the dozens.  This recipe can also be easily multiplied to make larger batches or larger cookies.
instructions: Mix all ingredients well and bake 12 minutes at 350. Do not over bake.
